intro: Erodium pilosum var. chaerophyllum, commonly known as the hairy erodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from spring to summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
